name: oj-diagram
description: Displays a set of nodes and the links between them. The node positions and link paths are specified by an application-provided layout function.

animationOnDataChange.description: Specifies the animation that is applied on data changes.

animationOnDisplay.description: Specifies the animation that is shown on initial display.

data.description: Specifies data source for the component.

dnd.description: Used to customize the drag and drop features.

nodes.description: Used to customize the drag features for nodes.

dataTypes.description: Specifies MIME type for dragged data.
Specifies MIME type for dragged data.

selector.description: Specifies DOM element selector used to start link creation.

drop.description: An object that describes drop functionality.

background.description: Allows dropping on the diagram background.

dataTypes.description: Specifies MIME types of objects that can be dropped on the Diagram background.
Specifies MIME types of objects that can be dropped on the Diagram links.
Specifies MIME types of objects that can be dropped on the Diagram nodes.

ports.description: Allows dropping a link end on a port.

dataTypes.description: Specifies MIME types of objects that can be dropped on the Diagram ports.

selector.description: Specifies DOM element selector used for link creation end.

expanded.description: Specifies the key set of ids for expanded diagram nodes.

focusRenderer.description: Specifies custom renderer for the diagram nodes used for focus updates.

highlightMatch.description: Specifies matching condition used for category highlighting.

hoverBehavior.description: Defines the behavior applied when hovering over diagram nodes and links.

hoverRenderer.description: Specifies custom renderer for the diagram nodes used for hover updates.

layout.description: Specifies layout callback used to position nodes and links.

linkProperties.description: Optional callback for customizing link appearance based on link data.

labelStyle.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the link label. The CSS max-width property can be used to truncate labels.

svgStyle.description: The SVG CSS style object defining link style. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the link and override any other styling specified through the properties.

svgClassName.description: The SVG CSS style class defining link style. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the link and override any other styling specified through the properties.

startConnectorType.description: Specifies the type of start connector on the link. Supported values are "arrowOpen", "arrow", "arrowConcave", "circle", "rectangle", "rectangleRounded", "none". Default value is "none".

endConnectorType.description: Specifies the type of end connector on the link. Supported values are "arrowOpen", "arrow", "arrowConcave", "circle", "rectangle", "rectangleRounded", "none". Default value is "none".

maxZoom.description: Specifies the maximum zoom level for this diagram.

minZoom.description: Specifies the minimum zoom level for this diagram.

nodeProperties.description: Optional callback for customizing node appearance based on node data.

showDisclosure.description: Determines when to display the expand/collapse button.Supported values are "on", "off". Default value is "on".

labelStyle.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the node label.

icon.description: Specifies an icon to be used as a graphical element for the node

borderColor.description: The border color of the icon.

borderRadius.description: The border radius of the icon. CSS border-radius values accepted. Note that non-% values (including unitless) get interpreted as 'px'.

color.description: The fill color of the icon.

pattern.description: The fill pattern of the icon.Supported values are "smallChecker", "smallCrosshatch", "smallDiagonalLeft", "smallDiagonalRight", "smallDiamond", "smallTriangle", "largeChecker", "largeCrosshatch", "largeDiagonalLeft", "largeDiagonalRight", "largeDiamond", "largeTriangle", "none".Default value is "none".

shape.description: The shape of the icon. Can take the name of a built-in shape or the svg path commands for a custom shape.Supported built-in shapes:"ellipse", "square", "plus", "diamond", "triangleUp", "triangleDown", "human", "rectangle", "star", "circle".Default value is "circle".

source.description: The URI of the node image.

sourceHover.description: The optional URI of the node hover image. If not defined, the source image will be used.

sourceHoverSelected.description: The optional URI of the selected image on hover. If not defined, the sourceSelected image will be used. If the sourceSelected image is not defined, the source image will be used.

sourceSelected.description: The optional URI of the selected image. If not defined, the source image will be used.

svgStyle.description: The CSS style object defining the style of the icon. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the icon and override any other styling specified through the properties.

svgClassName.description: The CSS style class defining the style of the icon. The style class and style object will be applied directly on the icon and override any other styling specified through the properties.

panDirection.description: Specifies if panning allowed in horizontal and vertical directions.

panning.description: Specifies whether panning is allowed in Diagram.

promotedLinkBehavior.description: Defines promoted link behavior for the component.

renderer.description: Specifies custom renderer for the diagram nodes used for initial rendering.

selection.description: An array containing the ids of the selected nodes and links.

selectionRenderer.description: Specifies custom renderer for the diagram nodes used for selection updates.

styleDefaults.description: An object defining the style defaults for this diagram.

hoverBehaviorDelay.description: Specifies initial hover delay in ms for highlighting data items.

color.description: Default link color. The default value comes from the CSS and varies based on theme.

endConnectorType.description: Specifies the type of end connector on the link.

labelStyle.description: Specifies CSS styles for the link label.

startConnectorType.description: Specifies the type of start connector on the link.

svgClassName.description: The default SVG CSS style class to apply to the link.

svgStyle.description: Specifies SVG CSS styles for the link.

icon.description: Default style for the node icon.

borderColor.description: Default border color of the icon.

borderRadius.description: Specifies default border radius of the icon.

borderWidth.description: Default border width of the icon in pixels.

pattern.description: Default fill pattern of the icon.

shape.description: Specifies default shape of the icon.

source.description: The URI of the node image

sourceHover.description: The optional URI of the node hover image.

sourceHoverSelected.description: The optional URI of the selected image on hover.

sourceSelected.description: The optional URI of the selected image.

svgClassName.description: The SVG CSS style class to apply to the node icon.

svgStyle.description: The default SVG CSS style object defining the style of the icon.

labelStyle.description: Specifies CSS styles for the node label.

showDisclosure.description: Determines when to display the expand/collapse button.

color.description: Default promoted link color. The default value varies based on theme.

endConnectorType.description: Specifies the type of end connector on the promoted link.

startConnectorType.description: Specifies the type of start connector on the promoted link.

svgClassName.description: The SVG CSS style class to apply to the promoted link.

svgStyle.description: The promoted style object represents the CSS style of the link. User defined custom CSS Styles will be applied directly on the link.

tooltip.description: An object containing an optional callback function for tooltip customization.

renderer.description: Specifies a function for a custom tooltip.

trackResize.description: Defines whether the element will automatically render in response to changes in size. If set to off, then the application is responsible for calling refresh to render the element at the new size.

translations.description:
A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this
component has no resources. Resources may be accessed and overridden individually or collectively, as seen in the examples. If the component does not contain any translatable resource, the default value of this attribute will be 
null. If not, an object containing all resources relevant to the component.

If this component has translations, their documentation immediately follows this doc entry.

componentName.description:
Used to describe the data visualization type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelAndValue.description:
Used to display a label and its value.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelClearSelection.description:
Text shown for clearing multiple selection on touch devices.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelCountWithTotal.description:
Used to display a count out of a total.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelDataVisualization.description:
Label for data visualizations used for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelInvalidData.description:
Text shown when the component receives invalid data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelNoData.description:
Text shown when the component receives no data.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

promotedLink.description:
Used for the promoted link tooltip - promoted link consists a single link.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

promotedLinkAriaDesc.description:
Used to describe promoted link type for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

promotedLinks.description:
Used for the promoted link tooltip - promoted link consists multiple links.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateCollapsed.description:
Used to describe the collapsed state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateDrillable.description:
Used to describe a drillable object for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateExpanded.description:
Used to describe the expanded state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateHidden.description:
Used to describe the hidden state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateIsolated.description:
Used to describe the isolated state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateMaximized.description:
Used to describe the maximized state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateMinimized.description:
Used to describe the minimized state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateSelected.description:
Used to describe the selected state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateUnselected.description:
Used to describe the unselected state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

stateVisible.description:
Used to describe the visible state for accessibility.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

zoomRenderer.description: Specifies custom renderer for the diagram nodes used for zoom updates.

zooming.description: Specifies whether zooming is allowed in Diagram.

getNode.description: Returns an object with the following properties for automation testing verification of the diagram node at the specified index.

getLink.description: Returns an object with the following properties for automation testing verification of the diagram link at the specified index.

getPromotedLink.description: Returns an object with the following properties for automation testing verification of the promoted link between specified nodes.

getContextByNode.description:
Returns an object with context for the given child DOM node. This will always contain the subid for the node,
defined as the 'subId' property on the context object. Additional component specific information may also be included.

For more details on returned objects, see context objects.

setProperty.description:
Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component
of the change, triggering a [property]Changed event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

getProperty.description: Retrieves a value for a property or a single subproperty for complex properties.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

setProperties.description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

ojBeforeExpand.description: Event handler for when a node is about to expand.

nodeId.description: the id of the expanding object

ojExpand.description: Event handler for after a node has expanded.

nodeId.description: the id of the expanded object

ojBeforeCollapse.description: Event handler for when a node is about to collapse.

data.description: the id of the collapsing object

nodeId.description: the id of the collapsing object

ojCollapse.description: Event handler for after a node has collapsed.

data.description: the id of the collapsed object

nodeId.description: the id of the collapsed object

contextMenu.description:
The contextMenu slot is set on the oj-menu within this element. 
This is used to designate the JET Menu that this component should launch as a context menu on right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific gesture. 
If specified, the browser's native context menu will be replaced by the JET Menu specified in this slot.

The application can register a listener for the Menu's ojBeforeOpen event. The listener can cancel the launch via event.preventDefault(), 
or it can customize the menu contents by editing the menu DOM directly, and then calling refresh() on the Menu.

To help determine whether it's appropriate to cancel the launch or customize the menu, the ojBeforeOpen listener can use component API's to determine which 
table cell, chart item, etc., is the target of the context menu. See the JSDoc and demos of the individual components for details. 

Keep in mind that any such logic must work whether the context menu was launched via right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific touch gesture.
